moves.1. e4 e5 2. Qh5 Nc6 3. Bc4 g6 4. Qf3 Nf6: Open up the center since we have the two Bishops
moves.11. b4 dxe4 12. Nxe4 Nxe4 13. dxe4 Be6 1: Probably better is b6 to prevent the Bishop from controlling c5 and  b6 and after Rd1 digging into b6
moves.15. Bc5 Re8 16. Rd1 Qf6: Dubious move. Probably better Qg5. If 17. ..Qc7 then 18. Bd6 and 17. ..Qc8 isolates the queen
moves.17. Qe2 Red8: We need to control the d-file so exchange rooks
moves.18. Rxd8+ Rxd8 19. Nf3 b5: preparing of white to castle and then 20. ..Bc4
moves.20. Nd2: White predicts the move and protects squares c4 and b3
moves.20... Qg5: Adding pressure on d2 with the intention of Bh6 or if white castles then Bxh3
moves.21. f3:
